item.title: Helldivers 2 Xbox Port Helped Increase PS5 and PC Sales
item.content:encoded:
It has been revealed that the release of Helldivers 2 on Xbox helped increase engagement as well as sales for the PS5 and PC versions.

Arrowhead Game Studios released Helldivers 2 for Xbox in August 2025, and that decision helped revitalise the game for a new platform of players. It was also revealed earlier this year that Helldivers 2 sold more on Xbox than PlayStation in its first six days, and now, it seems that the Xbox port has also helped bolster sales on other platforms.

Helldivers 2 Xbox Port Helped Provide a “Significant Increase in Sales” for PS5 and PC

Spotted by This Week in Video Games (via TheGamer), Sony Group CFO Lin Tao spoke about Helldivers 2’s Xbox port contributing towards PS5 and PC sales during a Q&A portion of the company’s earnings call. Tao first talked about how their live service titles “overall accounted for more than 40% of our first-party software revenue.” Even though performance is different for each title, they observed that live service games are “a recurring source of revenue” similar to the previous quarter.

Tao then spoke about Helldivers 2, stating that it was also released for Xbox in 2025 and “is doing extremely well.” The group CFO added that the Xbox port has not only helped bring in new players on Xbox but also increased engagement from existing users on PS5 and PC. This move has “resulted in a significant increase in sales of the title year on year.” Tao concluded, stating, “Building on this recent progress, we aim to strengthen our studio, business, and expand our IP franchises through continuous learning and improvement.”

In other news, the developers of Helldivers 2 are ‘looking into‘ GameGuard anti-cheat. Additionally, Arrowhead Game Studios has started work on a new game. item.title: New Legend of Zelda LEGO Set Coming in 2026
item.content:encoded:
LEGO has announced that a new Legend of Zelda set is coming in 2026, though details on what exactly it entails are scarce.

The partnership between LEGO and Nintendo has seen a host of epic sets released, including the Legend of Zelda Great Deku Tree 2-in-1 set and a host of Super Mario sets, and the catalogue is being expanded upon next year.

LEGO Teases New Legend of Zelda Set

A short video on the LEGO website shows a minifigure of Link, with Zelda blurred in the background, standing still as an ominous shadow approaches.

The video ends with a message for builders across the world, telling them to ‘Build the Legend’ and confirming a new set is coming in 2026. However, that’s all the details that are available for now.

LEGO and Nintendo are set for a big year in 2026, as it was revealed back in March that Pokémon sets are coming next year—coinciding with the 30th anniversary of the franchise.

Other Nintendo franchises that have received LEGO sets include Animal Crossing, Donkey Kong, and LEGO recreations of the iconic Nintendo Entertainment System and the original Game Boy.

What Legend of Zelda sets do you want to see created by LEGO? Let us know your suggestions in the Insider Gaming Discord.
